title: Bruiser Yasuo has no weaknesses tbh - and I blame Fervor.
body:
Yasuo already beats everything early game, which is the nature of his kit. There's not much you can do to weaken his early game minus making his HP pool or shield weaker because he has no resources and low cooldowns. 

But champions that generally beat Yasuo don't beat bruiser Yasuo. You can pick it into counter match ups and still win because you're able to stave off attack speed slows with Q/trinity procs and literally just be hard as fuck to kill. This isn't healthy, I do agree with many on here that these bruiser off builds aren't good for the game and they shouldn't be working. Sure, if you get ahead and snowball, it's whatever. But a champion like Yasuo who is designed to function off of crit isn't even building crit and is electing to go with bruiser builds, you've made damage too accessible in other areas while you can still cash in on durability from high HP items like Frozen Mallet and Steraks. 

Once again, I mostly blame keystones for this. Keystones are giving these offbuilds better scaling, which bruiser builds as off builds as a generalization fall off pretty hard. But because of shit like Fervor, TLD and even Grasp (which does decent damage too, especially with HP stacking), you're seeing all sorts of champions and champions with off-builds outputting amounts of damage they simply shouldn't be outputting. 

You guys seriously need to look into adjusting keystones because they offer too much power. They have made this game a nightmare to balance on so many levels.

replies.body:
Why is it that fervor is only broken on bruiser yasuo? Maybe the reasoning is in his kit

like his really low cooldown Q that applies fervor
And the knockup that comes with it for free every, like what, 5 seconds?

Why not make his Q only apply crit, and no other onhit effects

His Q is an empowered basic attack, A simple, Empowered Basic attack. Geez. Thing is Fervor stacks twice as fast for Melee Champs. Each basic attack gives you 2 stacks. While ranged champions get one stack per hit

And you certainly don't need a map to find another champion with a Q as an empowered basic attack.
who needs a map?

Ya {{champion:266}} literally {{champion:81}} no {{champion:114}} other {{champion:150}} champs {{champion:104}} can {{champion:39}} run {{champion:24}} fervor {{champion:11}} of {{champion:102}} battle, {{champion:77}} build {{champion:62}} tanky {{champion:5}} and {{champion:157}} win...
{{champion:105}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:48}}

> [{quoted}](name=venomous frost,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKYi2qd7,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-08-18T18:42:20.177+0000)
>
> Why is it that fervor is only broken on bruiser yasuo? Maybe the reasoning is in his kit
> 
> like his really low cooldown Q that applies fervor
> And the knockup that comes with it for free every, like what, 5 seconds?
> 
> Why not make his Q only apply crit, and no other onhit effects

Well fervor is not an onhit, abilities themselves proc fervor, something like triforce isn't unhealthy on Yasuo. And he wasn't _that_ bad before all these bruiser and mastery changes. I personally don't see the need for a nerf to his kit but damage on some of these items and masteries to be tuned down.

> [{quoted}](name=MRV DayDream,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKYi2qd7,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2016-08-19T02:21:41.527+0000)
>
> Well fervor is not an onhit, abilities themselves proc fervor, something like triforce isn't unhealthy on Yasuo. And he wasn't _that_ bad before all these bruiser and mastery changes. I personally don't see the need for a nerf to his kit but damage on some of these items and masteries to be tuned down.

Fervor IS an on-hit. Abilities do not proc Fervor, they increase stacks which are used to calculate the bonus on-hit damage for your next basic attack. Read the in-game, client, or wiki description. They all are very clear about it being an on-hit effect.

If Fervor applied on abilities, you can bet it would be THE mastery to take for any AD champion. Darius bleeding targets for an additional 112 damage per second for 5 seconds even at a single stack sounds just a LITTLE bit overpowered (it's coded as a spell effect, which can be confirmed by building Rylai's on him if you want to check for yourself).
Knockup comes every 7 or 8 seconds early game. Plus it has a cast time so that's even more time to react.
you can't react to it when he EQ you, and he can hold it for so long he just zones you off cs the entire time.

We may need to cut down the total power in the game and do a massive shift in where this power should be (Masteries, items, or base stats). 

And by we, I mean Riot. 

It all honestly feels like WoW before that stat squish of Warlords, way too many big numbers.

I still dislike how they didn't nerf it. "We want it to be the baseline of how powerful these masteries are" 

If they keep nerfing other masteries we'll get league of thunderlords again.

Because it's so goddamn useful for anyone and doesn't have a downside. 

A cooldown?  Doesn't really matter because of how universally useful it is.

I'm still not really convinced. Bruiser Yasuo still sees basically no pro play, even though Gnar is extremely popular in the pro scene right now. If he were really that strong, why are the pros still picking Irelia over him?

> [{quoted}](name=DunkinNoobs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKYi2qd7,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-08-18T19:08:28.274+0000)

Because irelia is easier to play and spikes harder with Trinity 

I also don't think bruiser yasuo would be good competitively.

And I don't mind normal yasuo, just this solo queue bruiser off build that doesn't lose to anything.

Honestly, it's not even Yasuo, but the items he uses. His core is {{item:3078}} {{item:3022}}. Both of those items are fairly overtuned right now. Mallet gives too much tankiness and Triforce is too cheap. Resolve those issues and Bruiser Yasuo will sort itself out. Fervors damage mid and late game could stand to be trimmed a bit as well: 112 damage on hit at lvl 18 is kinda ridiculous. I called that one being nerfed from the moment those numbers hit the pbe and I'm amazed they've lasted this long.

> [{quoted}](name=DunkinNoobs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKYi2qd7,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2016-08-18T19:27:47.462+0000)

Mallet gives too much tankiness and Triforce is too cheap. Resolve those issues and Bruiser Yasuo will sort itself out. Fervors damage mid and late game could stand to be trimmed a bit as well: 112 damage on hit at lvl 18 is kinda ridiculous. I called that one being nerfed from the moment those numbers hit the pbe and I'm amazed they've lasted this long.

yeah I agree, it's a combination of things. Trinity didn't need any changes tbh. Frozen Mallet is only good conditionally but in this case, it's abusive as hell because of all the on-hit yasuo's Q provides and his general stickiness. But I still hold fervor to be more responsible than anything.
As much as I like {{item:3022}} as an item (ah, fond S2 memories of Fratma's with FoN...), it has no real place in the game anymore.
What about Rylais?
Lol yep...  Entire threads dedicated to complaining about Rylai's being OP, and yet the majority of players still think Mallet sucks.

It is not that Mallet sucks. The problem is that most champions cannot take proper advantage of it. 

ADCs could take serious advantage of it due to their range, despite the fact that the slow is slighty weaker if you are ranged. However, they need to buy many other items first (attack speed items, crit items, armor pen items, lifesteal items) they simply don't have time to buy Frozen Mallet most of time.

Melee carries cannot take proper advantage of it because they are unsafe. Examples include Master Yi, Tryndamere, and Fiora. And just like ADCs, they need other items first.

Most bruisers do not auto-attack that much or they don't have a lot of mobility, so they are better off not purchasing Frozen Mallet.

Yasuo is one of the very few champions which can afford to build Frozen Mallet early. He doesn't really need other items first (except Trinity Force) and has a lot of stickiness, and with his kit, he can overcome the fact that he is melee.

> [{quoted}](name=DunkinNoobs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKYi2qd7,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-08-18T19:08:28.274+0000)
>
> I'm still not really convinced. Bruiser Yasuo still sees basically no pro play, even though Gnar is extremely popular in the pro scene right now. If he were really that strong, why are the pros still picking Irelia over him?

Tbh I kind of agree.

I mean, the build is certainly good, but I've not really seen or experienced anything that would convince me that it's so powerful.

If Yasuo really beat everyone early game (lol'd at that, he doesn't), and also became a champion with no weaknesses when built bruiser, why is he not a staple of pro play? He'd be easily the best top laner in the game.

> [{quoted}](name=PermabannedGaren,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IKYi2qd7,comment-id=00040002,timestamp=2016-08-19T00:39:53.447+0000)
>

> 
> I mean, the build is certainly good, but I've not really seen or experienced anything that would convince me that it's so powerful.
> 
> If Yasuo really beat everyone early game (lol'd at that, he doesn't), and also became a champion with no weaknesses when built bruiser, why is he not a staple of pro play? He'd be easily the best top laner in the game.

There aren't a lot of champions who actually beat him early game. Most bruisers actually lose to him early and then once they hit mid game with a durability+damage build, they can basically burst yasuo. Bruiser yasuo pretty much prevents him from being bursted. It takes a few items to get to that point (namely Trinity and FM) but once he does, he simply doesn't lose duels.
Im so sick of hearing about this champion.. Please just fucking delete him.

I agree to an extent that keystone masteries have lead to an array of balancing problems and just downright unhealthy gameplay/powercreep but I think in Yasuo's case, it's more of a combination of him just synergising too well with just about everything.
When Warlords was released and even after it got nerfed, we blamed the keystone moreso than Yasuo's ability to abuse it, Fervor was nerfed but even now we're going to attack it again just to get back at Yasuo.

While I'd rather play the game without masteries like all the season previous to this one, I think the real culprit for Yasuo's unending dilemma is Yasuo himself.
Fix Yas: make his abilities use energy.

>You guys seriously need to look into adjusting keystones because they offer too much power. 

OR, they could _remove_ them and revert back to the mastery system that worked.  That'd be much better for game health and balance.

Forget items and masteries, people need to stop excusing this overloaded mess of a champion every time he starts abusing a new build.

Maybe it isn't the items that are the issue, maybe it's the champion itself.

Riot needs to either rework him and give him an actual fucking weakness instead of leaving him as overloaded as he is now or remove him from the game.

not maybe 
its the champ for sure

I'm in the boat that wants keystones gone next season, I don't see how they can get them to a point where they are balanced.  Were the old masteries boring?  Sure, but they didn't break the game like the keystones do.   At least then they won't feel the need to destroy a champion just because a keystone is breaking them.
